thread.title: Mumbai Marathon Runner Crushed While Trying To Alight From Moving Train - Indiatimes.com
thread.title_full: Mumbai Marathon Runner Crushed While Trying To Alight From Moving Train - Indiatimes.com

title: Mumbai Marathon Runner Crushed While Trying To Alight From Moving Train - Indiatimes.com
text:
Vishal Rajemahadik February 10, 2017 
In an attempt to save an hour's journey, the life of a 20-year-old Vasai marathon runner was cut short. Lokesh Waghmare tried to alight from a moving express train in Vasai when he slipped and fell on the tracks, and was crushed to death. 
Mumbai Mirror 
Confirming the incident Vasai GRP Mahesh Bagwe informed that the incident happened when Waghmare tried to get down from a Swaraj Express that slowed down in Vasai. 
Waghmare was on his way back home from Vadodara. The sole breadwinner of the family was in the Gujarat city for a marathon. 
BCCL/Representational Image 
He is survived by his parents, and a widowed sister and her two children who all live in a Vasai East chawl. While his father is a mentally-challenged individual, his mother helped Waghmare ends meet by taking on odd-jobs as a maid. 
Originally Published in Mumbaimirror
